questions.question_text: An engineer is configuring Cisco Expressway-E and needs to implement toll fraud prevention. Which configuration meets this requirement?

choices.A: Enable SIP ALG inspection on the network address translation firewall.
choices.C: Enable and configure the Expressway-E firewall.
choices.B: Enable and configure local call policy.
choices.D: Configure the external firewall to block specific IPs.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Toll fraud prevention is about protecting a network from unauthorized calls that could lead to unexpected or excessive charges. In Cisco Expressway-E, local call policies can be used to restrict calls to authorized destinations, monitor, and potentially block fraudulent attempts based on configurable rules.

Selected Answer: B
Toll Fraud Prevention is quite literally one of the reasons Call Policy is even available on Expressways

Selected Answer: A
When backing up Cisco Expressway-C, the backup file is saved with the extension .tar.gz.enc by default. 
This format includes:
.tar: Indicates the file is an archive.
.gz: Indicates the archive is compressed using gzip.
.enc: Indicates the file is encrypted for security.
The .enc extension ensures that sensitive configuration data in the backup file is encrypted to protect against unauthorized access.

questions.question_text: What is the default file extension for saving Cisco Expressway-C backups when using the Google Chrome browser?

choices.D: Nothing is wrong, but the file type is most likely not XML.
choices.A: Add the command POST at the end on this line “http://myServer4/myPath4,block,,,POST”.
choices.B: Remove the Method “PUT” from “http://myServer2:8000/myPath2,allow “my deployment”, “an allow test”, PUT”.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A manager asks an engineer to create a CSV file for the HTTP allow list on the Expressway deployment. The engineer wrote the script shown and uploaded it to the Expressway, but it is not being accepted. Which action resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I would go with A.
There's even an example with the same script in Cisco documentation.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/config_guide/X15-0/mra/exwy_b_mra-deployment-guide-x150/exwy_m_http-allow-list-formats.html#reference_03884D99D0DEB11F18FE1AC6231A2E1B

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is C - Remove the line "https://myServer4/myPath4,allow,,,GET".

Explanation:
When configuring the HTTP Allow List on Cisco Expressway using a CSV file, all entries must conform to the expected format and avoid duplication. In this case:

-The URL https://myServer4/myPath4 appears twice in the script with different rules (allow and block).
-Expressway does not allow conflicting rules for the same URL path in the same HTTP Allow List. The line "https://myServer4/myPath4,allow,,,GET" conflicts with "http://myServer4/myPath4,block,,,,".

comments.content:
I couldn't find such a rule that says duplication of URL is not allowed. 
There's also an example with the same as the screenshot script here:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/config_guide/X15-0/mra/exwy_b_mra-deployment-guide-x150/exwy_m_http-allow-list-formats.html#reference_03884D99D0DEB11F18FE1AC6231A2E1B

choices.C: Add the web-server address within the HTTP server allow list on the Expressway-C.
choices.D: Add the web-server address within the HTTP server allow list on the Expressway-E.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct Answer:
C. Add the web-server address within the HTTP server allow list on the Expressway-C.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/expressway/212104-Configure-and-Troubleshoot-UDS-Contact-P.html
You can't add "http allow list" on Exp-E. This is possible on Exp-C only, so the correct answer is C

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. The web server is set up to store contact photos and the Cisco Jabber-config.xml file is updated for all clients. After these changes, Jabber for Windows users cannot view the contact photos when they are connected via Mobile and Remote Access. Which action resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct Answers:
B. Create _cisco-uds._tcp DNS SRV record in the internal DNS server.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/jabber/14_0/cjab_b_deploy-jabber-on-premises-14_0/cjab_b_deploy-jabber-on-premises-129_chapter_01101.html#CJAB_TK_C3219F67_00

Selected Answer: B
To resolve the "Cannot communicate with the server" error when users log in to Cisco Jabber from within the company network after deploying Mobile and Remote Access with automatic service discovery, the administrator must create a _cisco-uds._tcp DNS SRV record in the internal DNS server.

_cisco-uds._tcp:
This is the specific DNS record used for Cisco Unified Discovery Service (UDS), which is responsible for automatically discovering the necessary server information for Jabber to connect.
Internal DNS:
Since users are experiencing the issue while on the company network, the required DNS record needs to be accessible on the internal DNS server.

questions.question_text: After Mobile and Remote Access is deployed with automatic service discovery, end users encounter the error “Cannot communicate with the server” when they attempt to log in to Cisco Jabber 14.0 using the company email address from within the company network. Which action must an administrator take to resolve this challenge?

choices.B: Create _cisco-uds._tcp DNS SRV record in the internal DNS server.
choices.C: Create _collab-edge._tls DNS SRV record in the public DNS.
choices.A: Create _collab-edge._tcp DNS SRV record in the internal DNS.
choices.D: Create _cisco-uds._tcp DNS SRV record in the public DNS server.
